description_txt: stated on June 7, 2010 in a blog post:
quote_txt: "The last major oil spill from a drilling accident in America happened over 40 years ago in 1969."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2010 in an address from the Oval Office:
quote_txt: "I've issued a six-month moratorium on deepwater drilling."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2010 in an interview on CNN and a posting on Twitter:
quote_txt: The White House has "refused" international help in dealing with the oil spill.

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2010 in a statement at a hearing of a House Energy and Commerce subcommittee:
quote_txt: "Right now every single one of the (oil) companies here today and dozens of others are drilling for free in the Gulf of Mexico on leases that will cost American taxpayers more than $50 billion in lost royalties."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2010 in a Congressional hearing:
quote_txt: "While Exxon Mobil has 40 pages on its media response strategy, its plan for resource protection is only five pages long and its plan for oil removal is just nine pages long."

description_txt: stated on June 8, 2010 in a fundraising letter:
quote_txt: Alex Sink was "the first official who said that BP should pay $25 million for an ad campaign to promote Florida tourism."

description_txt: stated on June 9, 2010 in a newspaper article:
quote_txt: Says she was never a  member of the Georgia Log Cabin Republicans.

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Since 2000, "the Texas clean air program achieved a 22 percent reduction in ozone and a 46 percent decrease in NOx emissions."

description_txt: stated on June 9, 2010 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Of hospitals in Rick Scott’s Columbia/HCA health care company, "A top executive said they even turned away a poor man and left him to die outside their door."

description_txt: stated on June 6, 2010 in an interview with CNN's Candy Crowley.:
quote_txt: "BP is setting up claims offices throughout the state."

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2010 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: John McCain "voted against the tax cuts of 2001 and 2003, wrongly claiming they helped only the rich."

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2010 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: After J.D. Hayworth "was voted out of Congress, he became a registered lobbyist" who was "paid thousands by a Florida corporation to lobby the very committee he used to serve on."

description_txt: stated on June 13, 2010 in a discussion on ABC's 'This Week':
quote_txt: The Obama administration "has been constrained by the Oil Pollution Act of 1990, which basically gives the responsible party the lead role in trying to not only fix the problem, but contain the problem."

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2010 in a statement on ABC News' 'This Week.':
quote_txt: Ninety percent of the people in Arkansas still love Bill Clinton.

description_txt: stated on February 12, 2010 in a speech:
quote_txt: Georgia could get money for schools by scraping “the gold off the gold dome” of the state Capitol.

description_txt: stated on June 11, 2010 in a campaign press release:
quote_txt: "Gov. Crist's veto also clears the way for taxpayer funding of abortion in Florida."

description_txt: stated on June 13, 2010 in an interview on ABC's "This Week'':
quote_txt: "The Republicans didn't have a budget in '02, '04, '06."

description_txt: stated on June 13, 2010 in an interview on ABC's "This Week'':
quote_txt: "The House has never failed to pass a budget in the modern era."

description_txt: stated on May 20, 2010 in a campaign commercial for Bill McCollum:
quote_txt: Bill McCollum has "recovered $200 million in Medicaid fraud."

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2010 in an e-mail:
quote_txt: "Bill White has a long history of trying to limit or even disenfranchise military voters."

description_txt: stated on June 9, 2010 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: "A major part" of the climate change bill sponsored by Sens. John Kerry and Joe Lieberman "was essentially written by BP."

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2010 in a campaign video on his website:
quote_txt: Georgia has "a dropout rate that’s higher" than Alabama's.

description_txt: stated on May 25, 2010 in a press releaase:
quote_txt: "Georgia has a well-deserved reputation for setting the gold standard for food safety."

description_txt: stated on June 6, 2010 in a roundtable discussion on ABC's This Week:
quote_txt: The final pitch of Don Larsen's perfect game in the 1956 World Series "was a foot and half probably high and outside."

description_txt: stated on June 8, 2010 in a campaign mail piece.:
quote_txt: "Bill McCollum holds the same position on (embryonic stem cell research) as Barack Obama."

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2010 in his Fox News program:
quote_txt: "The 2000 Census cost $4.5 billion. The 2010 Census is set to cost up to $14.5 billion."

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2010 in a video on his campaign website:
quote_txt: California's credit rating is "the worst in the country."

description_txt: stated on April 30, 2010 in a press releaase:
quote_txt: While in Congress, Nathan Deal was a leader when it came to protecting our borders.

description_txt: stated on June 10, 2010 in a statement from his campaign:
quote_txt: Rick Scott's former health care company, Columbia/HCA, committed "fraud."

description_txt: stated on June 10, 2010 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: Starting in 2011, "you will be required to pay taxes" on "the value of whatever health insurance you are given by the company."
